article_title: Volatile Mix of World-Cup Soccer and Politics Raises a Din in Brazil
article_text:
Sao Paulo, Brazil—In the week since the World Cup tournament began, Brazilians have appeared almost as obsessed with a controversy that took place in the stands on opening day, as they have been with the action on the field.

At least three-times, Brazilians in the packed stadium that day joined in a prolonged and insulting chant against President Dilma Rousseff, who endured it from her seat in a glassed-off sky box.

What was...
